place.name: WHADDON
place.gazetteerText: WHADDON, a parish in the district and county of Gloucester; 3 miles S of Gloucester r. station. Post town, Gloucester. Acres, 727. Real property, £1,418. Pop., 125. Houses, 21. The property is divided among a few. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to Brookthorpe. The church was partly restored in 1855. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
